results.title: Roots. -Volume 3
results.brief_description: In the final episodes of “Roots”, Kunte Kinte’s grandson, Chicken George, finds himself in England when his owner uses him as payment to settle a gambling debt. He returns to his family fourteen years later, the first free man in his family. The Civil War begins and Chicken George fights for the Union. Emancipation reaches the blacks with the end of the Civil War, but hooded night riders still pursue them. Chicken George leads his family to a new home in Tennessee, concluding the saga that began with his grandfather, Kunte Kinte. Alex Haley narrates the epilogue. Cast also includes Lloyd Bridges, Georg Stanford Brown, Macdonald Carey, Olivia Cole and Chuck Connors. Written for television by James Lee, William Blinn and M. Charles Cohen.

results.title: Roots. -Volume 2
results.brief_description: In this second installment of Alex Haley’s classic novel, Kunta Kinte (John Amos), briefly escapes slavery but is captured again and crippled. His friendship with Fiddler terminates, but Kunte does fall in love and marries. His love for his wife and the need to care for their newborn daughter, Kizzy, prevents Kunte from escaping again. Jump forward 16 years and Kizzy (Leslie Uggams), is sold to a new master and bears him a son, Chicken George (Ben Vereen). Kizzy’s master, Samuel Bennett (Richard Roundtree) is sympathetic to Kizzy’s desire to see her parents, but they clash fiercly on his blase attitude towards slaves and his lack of interest in maintaining Kizzy’s African heritage. Kizzy returns to her birthplace and discovers the fate of her parents. Written for television by James Lee, M. Charles Cohen and William Blinn. Cast includes John Amos, Lynda Day George, Lorne Greene, Chuck Connors, Sandy Duncan, George Hamilton, Carolyn Jones and Louis Gossett Jnr. Music by Gerald Fried.

results.title: Roots. - Volume 1
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Alex Haley, “Roots” begins in Gambia, West Africa, 1750 with the birth of Kunta Kinte (Le Var Burton). Kunta’s life begins well, as he rises in the ranks within his community by distinguishing himself in manhood training rituals. His good fortune does not last long with the arrival of slave traders who capture Kunta and many of his tribesmen. They are chained together and begin an arduous journey on the slave ship, Lord Ligonier, bound for the New World. Kunta finds a friend in Fiddler (Louis Gossett Jr), a slave in charge of Kunta’s training. Kunta challenges the boundaries of their friendship when Fiddler discovers that Kunta is planning to escape with the female slave, Fanta (Ren Woods). This tape includes two episodes. Cast includes Edward Asner, O. J. Simpson, Ralph Waite, Maya Angelou and Ji-Tu Cumbuka. Music by Quincy Jones.

results.title: Roots of plants
results.brief_description: Various forms of roots are first presented. Time-lapse and micro-photography are employed to bring out the interesting processes of growth and the structure of the roots of plants. Animation is used to demonstrate osmosis.

results.title: Roots of happiness
results.creator_credit: Sun Dial Films, Puerto Rico. Dept. of Health and Henwar Rodakiewicz
results.brief_description: Docudram about two families in Puerto Rico, one a happy one in which the father and mother love each other and their children, the other one in which there are too many children, no understanding between the parents, and neglected and unhappy children, are contrasted to show the importance of well-adjusted, tolerant, loving parents in the development of happy productive children. Strong comparison made between children and trees, both of which should be planted far enough apart and in a number that can be properly cared for, thus raising questions of birth control.

results.title: Roots
results.brief_description: A remarkable film for its time which shows, by time-lapse microcinematography and the use of animation, details never before achieved of the processes of root growth. Photography by Percy Smith.

results.title: Room to learn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Early Learning Centrer and Joyce Chopra
results.brief_description: Shows an outstanding preschool facility - the Early Learning Center, Connecticut, whose design is based on the Montessori philosophy that the environment of early schooling affects a child’s learning processes over a lifetime.

results.title: Room service
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman, RKO Radio Pictures and William A. Seiter
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers are penniless Broadway producers, living in a hotel, who are planning a new stage show and are waiting for the finance to come through. As their hotel room becomes packed by members of the cast and the hotel bill escalates, the Marx Brothers devise a number of schemes to avoid eviction by the hotel’s management. Also stars Lucille Ball.

results.title: Room full of energy
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Martin Rosenbaum, Jon Savan, Ian Ferguson, Paul Sabella and Julian Harris
results.brief_description: A Room Full of Energy was produced to familiarize children with the concept of energy and to stimulate their interest in energy conservation. Through the magic of animation, the moon comes down from the sky to reveal the marvels of energy to a young boy and girl. The film describes the nature and role of every type of energy, from wood-burning to nuclear energy, illustrating where each comes from and how it is used. Music by Rick Elger.
